subject: Technology
title: Siri and Voice Assistants
description: A quick, practical guide to Siri and Voice Assistants.

hook.text: In 2011, Apple introduced Siri: a voice assistant you could talk to like a person.

buildup.text: Siri started as a DARPA-funded research project. Apple acquired the startup and baked it into the iPhone.

discovery.text: For the first time, millions of people spoke to their phones and expected useful answers.

twist.text: Siri often misunderstood requests and gave hilariously wrong answers. It became a comedy source.

climax.text: Siri inspired Amazon's Alexa, Google Assistant, and an entire industry of voice-controlled devices.

punchline.text: Siri wasn't great at answers. It was great at starting a revolution.

quiz.question: Where did Siri originally come from?
